intro: Diplycosia lilianae, commonly known as the Lilian's diplycosia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four to five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub with slender, woody stems and elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
